title: Instant Pot Linguine with White Clam Sauce

Sauce Base: 1/4 cup of extra virgin olive oil
1 1/2 cups of garlic or chicken broth
1/4 cup of a dry white wine
Juice from two 6.5 oz cans of chopped clams
Main Components: Two 6.5 oz cans of chopped clams, drained
8 oz of linguine, broken in half
For Finishing: 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese, plus more for topping

steps: Add the butter and oil to the Instant Pot. Hit “Sauté” on the “More” or “High” setting and wait until the butter has melted.
Add the shallots and cook for 1-2 minutes, then add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, then add in the white wine and let simmer for 1 minute more.
Add the broth, lemon juice, clam juice (NOT the clams), basil, oregano, parsley, Old Bay, and pepper and stir together well.
Break the linguine in half and lay it on top, pushing it all down under the liquid but NOT stirring.
Secure the lid and hit “Manual” or “Pressure Cook” High Pressure for 6 minutes. Quick release when done.
Stir in the clams and the Parmesan. Let sit for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, so the clams get heated through and the sauce thickens.
Transfer to a serving bowl, plate it up and sprinkle any extra Parmesan cheese if desired.
Serve with crusty Italian bread to sop up any leftover sauce.
